STATE OF MICHIGAN

GOVERNOR DIRECTOR

Patrick McKeage
BAY PINES CENTER
2425 N. 30TH STREET,
ESCANABA, MI, 49829-9203
Re: License #: CS210200969
Special Investigation #: 2023C0000517
Dear Mr. McKeage:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (2) The following restraints are strictly prohibited:
(e)Restraining youth in a prone position or any restraint that
restricts the youth’s airway.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation On 5/31/2023, Youth was restrained on her bed in the prone
position.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via TEAMS on June 2, 2023, and
reported he had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth A said on
Wednesday, May 31, 2023, she was in her room around 8pm for
medication passing and ripped up her shirt and tied it around her
neck. Youth A said Supervisor saw she had the shirt around her
neck but did not come into her room but rather did checks on her.
Youth A said Staff 1, Staff 5, and Supervisor were “dealing” with
Youth B so she did not get her medications right away. Youth A
said when Staff 5 began to pass her medications to her she
walked out of her room and Supervisor and Staff 1 went “right into
a restraint” while Staff 5 called for other staff assistance. Youth A
said Supervisor “pushed” her into her room and attempted to close
her door, but she would not allow it to be shut. Youth A said Staff
1 and Staff 2 “grabbed” her and tried to hold her arms and she
said she was “crawling” her legs up the wall to get out of their
hold. Youth A said someone grabbed her legs and she fell face-
down on her bed. Youth A said Staff 2 switched with Supervisor
and Supervisor held her face-down on her bed with her arms
pulled up behind her back. Youth A said she was “folded” with her
knees under her chest, and she was screaming that she was in
pain from her arms being pulled backwards and that she was not
able to breathe. Youth A said Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D
were all in their rooms and saw the restraint and were banging on
their doors to let her go. Youth A said Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and
Staff 5 were all clearing out her room and witnessed the restraint.
Youth A said once her room was cleared out the staff left, and
Supervisor let go and shut her door. Youth A said someone gave
her ice for her shoulder however she was not able to remember
which staff. Youth A said Staff 5 tried to talk with her, but she
refused to talk to Staff 5. Youth A said Supervisor came back to
her doorway later that evening and provided her with a safety
blanket, but she refused to use it. Youth A said she saw a nurse
two days after the restraint occurred. Youth A said the nurse told
her the pain would “go away after a few days” and said she would
recheck her arm if the pain did not go away. Youth A denied
having any bruising or swelling on her arm.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth B said
she is on the same pod at Youth A. Youth B said Youth A does
2

not like Supervisor as “he makes her mad”. Youth B said she was
in her room and did not see any of the restraint but did hear what
was going on. Youth B said Youth A refused her medications and
then said she wanted them, so staff were passing her medications
to her. Youth B said Youth A must have been trying to get out of
her room because she heard staff tell her to go back in her room.
Youth B said staff were clearing out Youth A’s room. Youth B said
she saw four staff and Supervisor on the unit that night. Youth B
said she heard Youth A crying and saying she wanted her mother.
Youth B said the following day Youth A told her that Supervisor
bent her arm during the restraint causing it to hurt.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth C said
she is “best friends” with Youth A, and they are on the same pod.
Youth C said Youth A was restrained on Wednesday, May 31,
2023, by Supervisor. Youth C said she was able to see the
restraint occur in Youth A’ s bedroom from her bedroom window,
as she was locked in her room. Youth C said Youth A was
standing on her bed telling staff to get out of her room. Youth C
said Supervisor grabbed Youth A’s arm and bent it backward
while Youth A was still standing on her bed. Youth C said Staff 1
and Staff 5 witnessed the restraint while all the other staff were
clearing out Youth A’s room. Youth C said Supervisor then “put
[Youth A] face down on her bed with one arm bent behind her
back”. Youth C said eventually all staff left Youth A’s room. Youth
C said Youth A was not able to receive medical attention for her
arm.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth D said
she is on the same pod as Youth A. Youth D said Youth A will
often get upset and yell at people which was what she had been
doing the night of May 31, 2023, prior to being restrained. Youth D
said Supervisor, Staff 2 and Staff 5 were the staff to restrain Youth
A. Youth D said Youth A pushed Staff 5 to get out of her room and
Staff 5 called for staff assistance. Youth D said Supervisor and
Staff 5 “pushed” Youth A back into her room. Youth D said once
Youth A was in her room, she was not able to see anything else
that occurred in the bedroom. Youth D said she saw staff bring
things out of Youth A’s room.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said he
was called down to Youth A’s pod from another pod. Staff 1 said
Youth A had tied something around her neck and the therapist
3

had been contacted. Staff 1 said Youth A had refused her
medications when it was medication passing time and then
decided she wanted them around 8pm. Staff 1 said Staff 5 was
passing Youth A’s medication and he was present for
“awareness”. Staff 1 said Youth A took her medications and then
began to push Staff 5 to get into common area. Staff 1 said he
escorted Youth A back into her room as it was bedtime, and she
was not to be in the common area. Staff 1 said when he went to
shut the door Youth A put her hands over the handle so it could
not be shut. Staff 1 said Staff 2 arrived for assistance and Youth A
began to “swing on them”. Staff 1 said Staff 2 had walked towards
Youth A and she backed up in a corner of her room. Staff 1 said
all other staff began to clear Youth A’s room due to her having tied
something around her neck earlier in the evening. Staff 1 said
Youth A punched Staff 2 so he went into a restraint. Staff 1 said
he then began to help clear out Youth A’s room and was not
directly involved in the restraint. Staff 1 said at one point he was
aware Youth A was on her bed however did not see her
positioning. Staff 1 said once everything was cleared out of Youth
A's room all staff exited the room and he went back to his unit.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 2 said he
was called to Youth A’s pod for a staff assistance call on
Wednesday, May 31, 2023. Staff 2 said when he arrived Youth A
was in her room holding her door to prevent Supervisor and Staff
1 from shutting it. Staff 2 said Supervisor waved him close and
then went into an escort to move Youth A away from her door.
Staff 2 said he was holding Youth A when Staff 1 grabbed his
beltloop pulling him backward, so he released thinking they were
ready to leave the room. Staff 2 said as soon as he let go of Youth
A she jumped up on her bed and began to punch Staff 1 so he
went back into a restraint and Youth A fell in the prone position on
her bed. Staff 2 said Supervisor was holding Youth A and had one
of her arms placed behind her back. Staff 2 said they are trained
to flip youth over if they are prone. Staff 2 said no one said
anything about flipping Youth A over. Staff 2 said Youth A was
prone for about a minute. Staff 2 said once the items were cleared
from Youth A’s room everyone exited and she was released.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 3 said he
was passing medications on his pod when he was called for staff
assistance on Youth A’s pod. Staff 3 said when he arrived the
medication cart was in front of Youth A’s door, and she was
punching one of the staff in her bedroom. Staff 3 said he began to
4

help remove items from Youth A’s room and was not paying close
attention to the staff that were handling Youth A inside the room.
Staff 3 said he removed Youth A’s mattress, and she was not
laying on it at that time. Staff 3 said once he removed the mattress
other staff were handing things to him out of the room so he did
not go back inside the room but rather took things from the staff
inside and moved it out in the common area of the pod. Staff 3
said he did not see Youth A in the prone position. Staff 3 said he
was trained to flip the youth over if they are prone as soon as it is
safe to do so.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on June 6, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 4 said he was
passing medications on his own unit when he was called for
assistance on Youth A’s unit. Staff 4 said once he arrived the
other staff were attempting to deescalate Youth A as she was
upset and yelling. Staff 4 said he was told to help clear out Youth
A's room so he went into Youth A’s room and Staff 2 had Youth A
in a standing restraint hold. Staff 4 said he was walking in and out
of the room clearing items out and at some point noticed Staff 2
had let go of Youth A and she was to punching Staff 2. Staff 4 said
he was then out of the room getting items handed to him and saw
that Staff 2 and Supervisor had Youth A face down on her bed.
Staff 4 said Staff 2 and Supervisor were holding Youth A's arms
down by her side when he saw them. Staff 4 said he remembered
hearing someone say they needed to flip Youth A over however
he did not see how the restraint ended as he was out in the
common area so was unsure if she was flipped onto her back or
not. Staff 4 said he was trained to flip a youth over as soon as
they are able if they go to the ground in a prone position.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on June 15, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 5 said she was
working Youth A’s unit on May 31, 2023. Staff 5 said Youth A had
been struggling throughout the evening and decided to go into her
room and take a break around 8:30pm. Staff 5 said when she
went to pass Youth A her night medications, Youth A refused and
had a t-shirt tied loosely around her neck. Staff 5 said between her
and Supervisor they continued to do frequent checks on Youth A
until she agreed to take her night medications. Staff 5 said Youth
A was told she needed to remove the shirt from her neck, and she
would give Youth A her medication. Staff 5 said she handed Youth
A her medications and Youth A set them on top of the medication
cart and said she would also like some ibuprofen. Staff 5 got the
ibuprofen and added it to her night medication and Youth A took
her medication. Staff 5 said Youth A then began to push past her
5

trying to get into the common area of the pod. Staff 5 said she
pushed the medication cart out of the way and blocked Youth A
from leaving her doorway with her backside. Staff 5 said she did
not want Youth A to get anything from the medication cart which
was why she pivoted in that direction. Staff 5 said Staff 1 escorted
Youth A back into her room and she called for staff assistance.
Staff 5 said Staff 2 arrived and went in Youth A’s room to help
Staff 1 and Supervisor. Staff 5 said Youth A was punching Staff 1
and Staff 2 while she and other staff were clearing out Youth A’s
room due to the self-harm behaviors she had previously exhibited.
Staff 5 said she did not see the entire restraint but did see at one
point Youth A, Staff 1 and Staff 2 all standing on Youth A’s bed,
and Youth A was punching the staff. Staff 5 said she never saw
Youth A in the prone position. Staff 5 said everything was very
noisy and chaotic during the incident that she does not recall
Youth A saying anything specifically other than cussing and
screaming. Staff 5 said once everyone was out of the room she
went back and talked to Youth A about the incident. Staff 5 said at
that time Youth A did disclose her arm hurt so Staff 5 put in a
medical slip for Youth A’s arm. Staff 5 said she was trained to flip
a youth over as soon as possible if they go into a prone position.
Staff 5 said she wrote the incident report after the situation to the
best of her ability without being a part of or seeing much of the
restraint.
Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on June 15, 2023,
in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Supervisor said he
was helping out on Youth A’s pod the night of May 31, 2023.
Supervisor said Youth C is Youth A’s “girlfriend” and had made a
comment to Youth A that upset her right at medication passing
time. Supervisor said Youth A got upset by whatever the comment
was from Youth C and tied a shirt loosely around her neck and
began to run around her bedroom. Supervisor said he checked in
on Youth A and saw she was not in any distress and asked if she
wanted to talk and she said “no” and then he asked if she was
ready to take her medications and she said “no” so he went to
help Staff 5 with Youth B who was also struggling a few doors
down from Youth A’s room. Supervisor said he continued to do
frequent checks on Youth A encouraging her to take the shirt from
around her neck. Supervisor said after a few minutes Youth A
asked for her night medications and was told yes but that she
needed to remove the shirt from her neck which she agreed to do.
Supervisor said Staff 5 opened Youth A’s door and passed her
night medications which she took and then began to violently
shove past Staff 5 to get out into the common area. Supervisor
said Staff 1 was also on the pod as he had been called down for
6

another situation so Supervisor and Staff 1 placed Youth A in an
escort and moved her back in her room. Supervisor said Staff 5
called for additional assistance while they were escorting Youth A
back in her room and Staff 2 arrived and assisted Staff 1 by
placing Youth A in a standing restraint while he and the other staff
began to clear out Youth A’s room due to the self-harm behaviors
she had previously exhibited. Supervisor said Youth A was
standing on her bed with her back against the wall punching any
staff that got close to her. Supervisor said at that point staff were
not able to exit the room until all the items were cleared from
Youth A’s room for safety. Supervisor said Staff 1 and Staff 2 were
getting punched as they attempted to get Youth A into a secure
hold. Supervisor said one of the staff tried to get ahold of Youth
A’s arm and she fell forward landing prone on her bed. Supervisor
said he took ahold of one of Youth A’s arms and held it loosely
behind her back so that she could not continue to punch.
Supervisor said Staff 2 had Youth A’s other arm but was unsure if
it was behind her back or to her side. Supervisor said Youth A was
struggling throughout the restraint. Supervisor said with the
position that Youth A landed he was not able to flip her onto her
back as the wall would prevent him from rolling her one way and
she would fall off the bed if he rolled the other way so he held her
until the staff completely cleared out her room and all staff exited
and closed the door. Supervisor said he held her prone for less
than ten seconds.
Video Review:
Video footage of May 31, 2023, Youth A’s pod was reviewed
on June 5, 2023. Youth A is seen getting medications and then
walking out of her doorway. Staff 5 moves between Youth A and
the common area and Staff 1 and Supervisor place Youth A in an
escort and walk her back into her room. Once Youth A is placed in
her room there is no longer video footage of what occurs inside
the bedroom as there are no cameras in the room and no
cameras that point into the room. Staff 5 is outside Youth A’s door
and calls over the radio for assistance, Supervisor is standing in
doorway, Staff 1 in inside Youth A’s bedroom, and Youth A
continues to state “I don’t give a fuck” as staff explain it is bedtime
and they need to remove items from her room due to the self-
harm incident. Staff 2 and Staff 4 arrive on pod and walk over to
Youth A’s door. Youth A’s arm are seen swinging at the
Supervisor making contact with his upper body at which time Staff
2 and Staff 4 enter the room with Supervisor standing in doorway
stating, “you will get to be out tomorrow, get off the door”. Staff 3
enters the pod and walks over to Youth A’s room. Staff 4 exits
Youth A’s room, leaving Staff 1 and Staff 2 in Youth A’s room.
7

Youth A is heard screaming “get the fuck off me bitch”. Supervisor
states, “put her in the corner and exit the room” and then enters
the room. Supervisor is seen moving items out of Youth A’s room.
Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5 all enter the room and remove items
from the bedroom. Youth A is heard saying “ouch”, a staff is heard
saying “stop punching”. Youth A is heard saying “you pushed my
arm” and staff say “no”. Youth A is then heard crying and cussing.
Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5 finish moving items out of Youth A’s
room. Supervisor, Staff 2, and Staff 1 all walk out of Youth A’s
room and the door is closed. The entire duration of the incident,
from the time Youth A is getting her medications until the time
when all staff exit her room and close her door is three minutes
and eighteen seconds.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on June 5, 2023. A tour of girls
one pod was completed. Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth
D’s rooms were viewed. During the tour I stood inside Youth C’s
room with the door closed and looked into Youth A’s room. When
in Youth C’s room I was only able to see a small corner of Youth
A's bed and none of the rest of the bedroom. The description of
the incident that Youth C said she witnessed is highly unlikely
given the view from her room into Youth A’s room.
Documents Reviewed:
• Supervisor personnel file: There was one disciplinary
record on file from April 24, 2019, for missing checks on
youth. Supervisor completed the required Handle with Care
training on February 21, 2023.
• Incident Report 155670204 dated May 31, 2023. The
incident report is consistent with Staff 5’s interview. Staff 5
did not participate in the restraint and did not witness the
entire restraint as she was clearing out Youth A’s room
therefore details from the restraint, including positioning,
were left out of the report.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance of youth restraint. Youth A
reported she was in the prone position. Staff 2, Staff 4, and
Supervisor all report Youth A being held in the prone position for
varying lengths of time.
Technical Assistance:
It is recommended the facility require the incident reports be
written by the individual involved in the entire incident or restraint.
If that is not possible, having more than one staff provide a
narrative for the incident report in order to have all of the correct
information included in the report.
8

Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraint; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/31/2023, Youth was restrained, and Staff bent Youth's arm
behind her back and pulled causing pain.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via TEAMS on June 2, 2023, and
reported he had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth A said on
Wednesday, May 31, 2023, she was in her room around 8pm and
placed in a restraint. Youth A said she was face-down on her bed
and Staff 2 switched with Supervisor and Supervisor held her
face-down on her bed with her arms pulled up behind her back.
Youth A said she was “folded” with her knees under her chest,
and she was screaming that she was in pain from her arms being
pulled backwards and that she was not able to breathe. Youth A
said Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were all in their rooms and
saw the restraint and were banging on their doors to let her go.
Youth A said Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 5 were all clearing
out her room and witnessed the restraint. Youth A said once her
room was cleared out the staff left, and Supervisor let go and shut
her door. Youth A said someone gave her ice for her shoulder
however she was not able to remember which staff. Youth A said
Staff 5 tried to talk with her, but she refused to talk to Staff 5.
Youth A said she saw a nurse two days after the restraint
occurred. Youth A said the nurse told her the pain would “go away
after a few days” and said she would recheck her arm if the pain
did not go away. Youth A denied having any bruising or swelling
on her arm.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth B said
the following day Youth A told her that Supervisor bent her arm
9

during the restraint causing it to hurt. Youth B denied seeing
Supervisor restrain Youth A.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth C said
Youth A was restrained on Wednesday, May 31, 2023, by
Supervisor. Youth C said she was able to see the restraint occur
in Youth A’ s bedroom from her bedroom window, as she was
locked in her room. Youth C said Youth A was standing on her
bed telling staff to get out of her room. Youth C said Supervisor
grabbed Youth A’s arm and bent it backward while Youth A was
still standing on her bed. Youth C said Staff 1 and Staff 5
witnessed the restraint while all the other staff were clearing out
Youth A’s room. Youth C said Supervisor then “put [Youth A] face
down on her bed with one arm bent behind her back”. Youth C
said eventually all staff left Youth A’s arm.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth D said
she did not see the restraint occur with Youth A. Youth D said the
next day Youth A told her that her arms hurt from Supervisor
bending them during the restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said he
did not see how Supervisor was holding Youth A during the
restraint. Staff 1 said he did not see Supervisor doing anything
inappropriate.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 2 said he
saw Youth A in the prone position with Supervisor holding one of
her arms behind her back. Staff 2 said he never saw Supervisor
pulling on Youth A’s arm or placing any tension on her arm. Staff 2
said he did not hear Youth A say her arm hurt during or after the
restraint.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 3 said he
did not see Youth A in the prone position, nor did he see
Supervisor pulling on Youth A’s arms. Staff 3 said he heard Youth
A swearing at staff but did not hear her say anything about her
arm or being in pain. Staff 3 said he has not worked with Youth A
since the incident.
10

Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on June 6, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 4 said he never
saw Supervisor or any staff holding Youth A’s arms behind her
back, stating when he saw Youth A on her bed her arms were
being held to her sides. Staff 4 said Youth A was screaming she
was going to assault staff as soon as she was allowed up. Staff 4
said she did make a comment about her arms hurting at one point
during the restraint. Staff 4 said he has not had contact with Youth
A since the restraint.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on June 15, 2023, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 5 said she did not
hear Youth A yelling that she was in pain during the restraint. Staff
5 said she did not see Supervisor or any other staff pulling Youth
A’s arms behind her back. Staff 5 said after the restraint was
done, she talked to Youth A and Youth A told her that her arm
hurt. Staff 5 said she put in a post-restraint medical slip and
offered Youth A ice however she refused it. Staff 5 said Youth A
complained that her arm hurt for two days however never asked
for ice or ibuprofen for the pain.
Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on June 15, 2023,
in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Supervisor said Youth
A never yelled that her arm was hurting throughout the restraint.
Supervisor said he was not holding her arm tight and there was no
tension on her arm to cause injury. Supervisor said he talked to
Youth A after the restraint, and she never said her arm hurt.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A medical visit progress notes dated June 1, 2023.
The medical notes indicate an evaluation due to “being
restrained and right great toe pain”. The medical note state
Youth A reports her shoulder was sore and her knuckles
were painful. The physical exam noted “normal
appearance” with a note under arm stating “right hand
range of motion is unaffected. Quick to make a fist.
Negative metacarpal squeeze test. No pain upon palpation
of the 2nd and 3rd fingers. Skin of the hand is clean, dry, and
intact”.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with youth restraint. Youth A
was prone (addressed in prior citation) with at least one arm
behind her back; however, no staff or Supervisor report Youth A’s
arm was being pulled or any tension was being stressed on the
arm. The nurse examined Youth A the next day and described her
arm as “normal” with no follow up needed.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
11

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/31/2023, Youth was restrained, and Staff laughed at Youth
yelling in pain.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via TEAMS on June 2, 2023, and
reported he had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth A said on
Wednesday, May 31, 2023, she was in her room around 8pm and
placed in a restraint. Youth A said she was face-down on her bed
and Staff 2 switched with Supervisor and Supervisor held her
face-down on her bed with her arms pulled up behind her back.
Youth A said she was “folded” with her knees under her chest,
and she was screaming that she was in pain from her arms being
pulled backwards and that she was not able to breathe. Youth A
said while she was screaming in pain Supervisor was laughing at
her.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth B said
she heard Youth A crying and saying she wanted her mother.
Youth B denied hearing Youth A screaming in pain or Supervisor
laughing.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on June 5,
2023, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth C said
